citation.article-title: Methylohalomonas lacus gen. nov., sp. nov. and Methylonatrum kenyense gen. nov., sp. nov., methylotrophic gammaproteobacteria from hypersaline lakes.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Methylonatrum [Me.thy′lo.na.trum. N.Gr. n. methyl (from Gr. n. methu wine and Gr. n. hulê wood) the methyl radical; N.Gr. n. natron arbitrarily derived from the Arabic n. natrun or natron soda; N.L. neut. n. Methylonatrum methyl-group-utilizing, soda (-loving bacterium)].
Autotrophic Calvin–Benson cycle is used for carbon assimilation during methylotrophic growth.
C18 : 1ω7 is the dominant cellular fatty acid.
The genus belongs to the Gammaproteobacteria.
Known habitat is soda lakes. Methylonatrum kenyense is the type species.
